In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the solution written in Julia programming language.
```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df[:dt])
end
```
In this function `add_yearmonth`, we are using the `map` function to apply a transformation to every value in the column `:dt`. The transformation is done by the anonymous function `(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x))`. This function extracts the year and month from the date time object `x` and returns an integer of the format "yyyymm".

This new column `ym` is then added to the DataFrame `df` using the `:ym` symbol.
